questions.question: The property of sand due to which gas and steam escapes from sand is:

explanations.a: Permeability in sand refers to its ability to allow gases (such as air or steam) to pass through it. In casting processes, including sand casting, permeability is a critical property because it allows gases generated during pouring (due to molten metal entering the mold) or during solidification (due to the release of gases from the metal) to escape freely from the mold cavity. This prevents defects like gas porosity in the casting.

questions.question: The amount of draft required does not depends upon:

explanations.a: Larger and more complex shapes generally require more draft to facilitate easy removal from the mold.
explanations.b: Different molding methods may have specific requirements for draft angles to ensure proper mold filling and pattern removal.
explanations.c: The material of the pattern used (option c) does not typically affect the amount of draft required.
explanations.d: Whether the casting is made using sand casting, investment casting, or other methods can influence the required draft angles.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of core according to their position:

explanations.a: This type of core is positioned horizontally within the mold cavity.
explanations.b: This type of core is positioned vertically within the mold cavity.
explanations.c: This type of core is positioned at an angle within the mold cavity.
explanations.d: inclined is not a standard type of core position classification in casting terminology. Core positions are typically described as horizontal or vertical, and inclined cores would generally fall under a specific angular orientation within the mold cavity rather than as a separate classification term.
